alert.note: Alert for Haines Borough and Klukwan; Municipality of Skagway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 04 at 7:17PM AKST until December 05 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...LONG DURATION HEAVY SNOW EVENT FOR THE HIGHWAYS... .A Gale-force low in the Gulf of Alaska is bringing precipitation to the Panhandle. Northerly winds in Northern Lynn Canal are keeping cooler air in place along the Highways, so the precip is falling as snow. Snow has been falling all afternoon and evening along the entire length of the Haines Highway and above a few hundred feet on the Klondike. The snow is expected to continue through the night and Tuesday morning with areas away from Lynn Canal seeing the most snow accumulation. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 12 inches. * WHERE...Klondike Highway, Haines Highway, and Klukwan. * WHEN...Until noon AKST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...For Haines and the Haines Highway, Heavy snow is expected to move back in Monday night into Tuesday morning. For the Klondike Highway, moderate snowfall is expected Monday evening with heavy snow moving in late Monday night and persisting into Tuesday morning.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water with you in case of an emergency. Heavy wet snow will be difficult to manage due to high water content. People are urged to prepare their property before the onset of winter weather. For the latest road conditions, where available, call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
